programme.title: The Mercy
Samo more zna
programme.desc:
The Mercy: Directed by James Marsh. With Colin Firth, Eleanor Stagg, Rachel Weisz, Zara Prassinot. The incredible story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe. The struggles he confronted on the journey while his family awaited his return is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent times." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3319730/","name":"The Mercy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzODQ5NjA3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI4MjkxNDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The incredible story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe. The struggles he confronted on the journey while his family awaited his return is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3319730/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AlexLindh"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good movie, but still a big disappointment","reviewBody":"As many have mentioned before, the documentary "Deep Water" is better at telling the story than this film, but "The Mercy" still has its merits. The movie looks great for the most part in its 1960's setting, and the actors all do their jobs. I particularly liked David Thewlis and Rachel Weisz in their roles. Colin Firth is also good, but looks like a sad dog for much of the movie, even before his character gets into trouble in the beginning and eventually sets sail.

The movie almost rushes through the intro, with rapid speaking lines and stressed scenes that don't feel all that natural. This is actually a problem all the way through, as it never slows down enough for us to truly take in the isolation and loneliness that Donald Crowhurst (Colin Firth, that is) must have felt in real life. We spend too much time on land and too little time at sea. As with many other films, it's hard to translate human thoughts onto the big screen ("The Old Man and the Sea" must be the classic example of this), and "The Mercy" fails on this note more often than it succeeds.

I do, however, still recommend the film, because it is still a good movie with good actors, and it's worth watching. It's just a shame that it doesn't reach its full potential, with a fascinating story such as this one.

I haven't seen "Crowhurst" (produced at the same time as "The Mercy", but by a different studio), but I've heard that that one is a bit better. In the end, "Deep Water" seems to be the best choice, however.

UPDATE (8 November, 2018): I have now seen "Crowhurst", and I am not sure if it's better than "The Mercy". I gave both films six stars. They are very different, however, as "Crowhurst" is more of a low-budget, theatrical art house film. It is also a character study, rather than a story-driven movie. Because of this, I think both films are worth watching, for their own reasons. "Deep Water" tells the story better than either of them, however and is indeed the best choice to watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8297,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Adventure","Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-02-09","keywords":"boat race,boat,sailing,lost at sea,period drama","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi297383961","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NGFjNjktYmFkNi00YTU5LWIyNDgtOTllZTk5NmE4OTY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NGFjNjktYmFkNi00YTU5LWIyNDgtOTllZTk5NmE4OTY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Yachtsman Donald Crowhurst's disastrous attempt to win the 1968 Golden Globe Race ends up with him creating an outrageous account of traveling the world alone by sea."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000147/","name":"Colin Firth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5663632/","name":"Eleanor Stagg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001838/","name":"Rachel Weisz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1016428/","name":"James Marsh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010002/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1994243/","name":"Scott Z. Burns"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: --- Actors: Colin Firth (role=Donald Crowhurst), Eleanor Stagg (role=Rachel Crowhurst), Rachel Weisz (role=Clare Crowhurst), Zara Prassinot (role=Waterskiing Girl), Oliver Maltman (role=Dennis Herbstein), Mark Gatiss (role=Ronald Hall), Simon McBurney (role=Sir Francis Chichester), Sam Hoare (role=Mr. Hughes), Avye Leventis (role=Mrs. Hughes), Finn Elliot (role=James Crowhurst), Kit Connor (role=Simon Crowhurst), Andrew Buchan (role=Ian Milburn)

IMDb data; ttnr: 3319730, Title: The Mercy, --- Description: The Mercy: Directed by James Marsh. With Colin Firth, Eleanor Stagg, Rachel Weisz, Zara Prassinot. The incredible story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe. The struggles he confronted on the journey while his family awaited his return is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent times." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3319730/","name":"The Mercy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzODQ5NjA3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI4MjkxNDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The incredible story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe. The struggles he confronted on the journey while his family awaited his return is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent ","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3319730/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"AlexLindh","dateCreated":"2018-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good movie, but still a big disappointment","reviewBody":"As many have mentioned before, the documentary "Deep Water" is better at telling the story than this film, but "The Mercy" still has its merits. The movie looks great for the most part in its 1960's setting, and the actors all do their jobs. I particularly liked David Thewlis and Rachel Weisz in their roles. Colin Firth is also good, but looks like a sad dog for much of the movie, even before his character gets into trouble in the beginning and eventually sets sail.

The movie almost rushes through the intro, with rapid speaking lines and stressed scenes that don't feel all that natural. This is actually a problem all the way through, as it never slows down enough for us to truly take in the isolation and loneliness that Donald Crowhurst (Colin Firth, that is) must have felt in real life. We spend too much time on land and too little time at sea. As with many other films, it's hard to translate human thoughts onto the big screen ("The Old Man and the Sea" must be the classic example of this), and "The Mercy" fails on this note more often than it succeeds.

I do, however, still recommend the film, because it is still a good movie with good actors, and it's worth watching. It's just a shame that it doesn't reach its full potential, with a fascinating story such as this one.

I haven't seen "Crowhurst" (produced at the same time as "The Mercy", but by a different studio), but I've heard that that one is a bit better. In the end, "Deep Water" seems to be the best choice, however.

UPDATE (8 November, 2018): I have now seen "Crowhurst", and I am not sure if it's better than "The Mercy". I gave both films six stars. They are very different, however, as "Crowhurst" is more of a low-budget, theatrical art house film. It is also a character study, rather than a story-driven movie. Because of this, I think both films are worth watching, for their own reasons. "Deep Water" tells the story better than either of them, however and is indeed the best choice to watch.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8297,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Adventure","Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-02-09","keywords":"boat race,boat,sailing,lost at sea,period drama","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi297383961","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NGFjNjktYmFkNi00YTU5LWIyNDgtOTllZTk5NmE4OTY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NGFjNjktYmFkNi00YTU5LWIyNDgtOTllZTk5NmE4OTY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Yachtsman Donald Crowhurst's disastrous attempt to win the 1968 Golden Globe Race ends up with him creating an outrageous account of traveling the world alone by sea.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000147/","name":"Colin Firth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5663632/","name":"Eleanor Stagg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001838/","name":"Rachel Weisz"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1016428/","name":"James Marsh"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010002/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1994243/","name":"Scott Z. programme.title: Dheepan
Dheepan
programme.desc:
Dheepan: Directed by Jacques Audiard. With Jesuthasan Antonythasan, Kalieaswari Srinivasan, Claudine Vinasithamby, Vincent Rottiers. Dheepan is a Sri Lankan Tamil warrior who flees to France and ends up working as a caretaker outside Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4082068/","name":"Dheepan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzc1NzgwMzgyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzAwMzQ1ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Dheepan is a Sri Lankan Tamil warrior who flees to France and ends up working as a caretaker outside Paris.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4082068/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lasttimeisaw"},"dateCreated":"2016-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't immigrate to France, all those war refugees","reviewBody":"Watched this prestigious Palme d'Or winner in the local art house cinema Zawya, it is French auteur Jacques Audiard's seventh feature film, who is on a hot streak in the past decade, from THE BEAT THAT MY HEART SKIPPED (2005), to A PROPHET (2009), then RUST AND BONE (2012), now finally DHEEPHAN hits the home run in his motherland.

To escaping from the living hell of a defeated war in Sri Lanka, a Tamil freedom fighter Dheepan (Antonythasan, who was a real-life boy solider of Tamil Tiger before fleeing to France), forges a family with Yalini (Srinivasan), a young woman in her early twenties and Illayaal (Vinasithamby), a nine-year-old girl, which facilitates the process of seeking asylum in Europe, and they end up in a Le Pré, a suburban area of Paris (although Yalini hopes to go to the Great Britain, where her cousin is) where anarchy is still held rampant among local gangsters. In spite of their language debacle, Dheepan becomes a caretaker of a derelict housing block and he also finds a job for Yalini, as a hourly maid to attend to a senior uncle of the gangster member Brahim (Rottiers), who has just been released from the penitentiary for probation, whereas Illayaal enrols in the local school where she has a tough time to blend in.

Paris, even the suburban area, should be a safe haven for the makeshift family taking flight from a war zone, but in Audiard's conception, France is far cry from a paradise for immigrants and refugees, hooliganism and gang war threaten Dheepan and his family's life almost on a daily basis, which is an ever so familiar situation for them, as if the shadows of war have tracked them from their native country to another continent, no exit is on the horizon, everywhere seems to be a dead-end, life is almost the same, worthless, in spite of being accommodated in a quite comfy apartment and earning a self-sufficient wages, they can be dispatched by the flying bullets any time on the streets, even under the broad daylight. Sooner or later, the straining mental stress will implode, especially for Yalini, whose working condition becomes increasingly precarious since she deals with gangster members first-hand, a highly-stylish set piece where Dheepan single-handedly takes on the droogs to save Yalini, with unusual subjective camera angle and heightened slo- motion shots aiming persistently to the waist-below, it is Audiard's intemperate stunt to impress after holding it back for a long time, nevertheless it deficiently appeases what viewers anticipate (especially when Dheepan's provocative behaviour of drawing the line between warring gangsters receives no personal danger to him or whatsoever) - to exaggerate Dheephan's "heroic act" as if he is the action hero who is capable to calmly finishing off his enemies one by one with great panache, is too much a stretch, even for someone with his battlefield background, since his life is too insignificant to matter under the radical situations which Audiard insists to lead us on. So is the ambiguous happy ending in England, a dream too perfect to be true which contradicts the harsh realism which Audiard intently fabricates.

Where all three main actors are non-professionals, it is pleasing to watch a tangible bond has been built between Yalini and Brahim, lost in translation, they don't understand each other's language, but the beguiling charm and draw between total strangers has reached its well-received receptor without put civil decency at its expense. In spite of being an allegorical account of a seemingly ordinary person's unexpected hidden depths, DHEEPHAN arrives topically in the current muddy waters of immigrants and war refugees in Europe, it leaves the impression of a self-justifying excuse to warn those unfortunately masses, but maybe they are not deeming Europe as the promised land, for them, any place other than their levelled home, is an egress from danger and poverty, so, at such desperation, it is well worth it.

One particularly telling scene of Audiard's poetic creativity is when the location transitions from Sri Lanka to Paris, the blurry fluorescent light slowly reveals itself being generated from a plastic hat which Dheepan wears when he is hawking on the street of Paris with other immigrants, such sleight-of-hand is mesmerising, alas, there is just not enough of them in this Palme d'Or crowner.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15451,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-08-26","keywords":"tamil,caretaker,france,sri lankan,janitor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2043853337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjNkZjFkNjEtZWE2Ni00YTI2LWJmNjktYWRjZmIwNTA2MDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjNkZjFkNjEtZWE2Ni00YTI2LWJmNjktYWRjZmIwNTA2MDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7316147/","name":"Jesuthasan Antonythasan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7316148/","name":"Kalieaswari Srinivasan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7316149/","name":"Claudine Vinasithamby"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002191/","name":"Jacques Audiard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049689/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0258767/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002191/","name":"Jacques Audiard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0081179/","name":"Thomas Bidegain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4380548/","name":"Noé Debré"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rush
Rush
programme.desc:
Rush: Directed by Ron Howard. With Chris Hemsworth, Daniel Brühl, Olivia Wilde, Alexandra Maria Lara. The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1979320/","name":"Rush","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWEwODJmZDItYTNmZC00OGM4LThlNDktOTQzZjIzMGQxODA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1979320/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tj_seabrook"},"dateCreated":"2013-09-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Superb all round","reviewBody":"Having seen the trailers and TV set-up (BBC as a Grand Prix insert) I was thinking OK so I've probably seen the best of this and it's going to be 'clunky' in parts or too far up it's own a$$.

But hey we can all be wrong, Ron Howard has added depth to a story I knew well, the presentation has a feel for the era the colour's are sometimes harsh and edgy.

The set pieces are well researched, the owners of some of the classic F1 hardware must have had an enjoyable time (not quite so sure about the Insurance Underwriters).

Where the story hits the spot for me is the acting of the main protagonists, they have life and depth. Hemsworths presentation of James Hunt is uncanny it's like a documentary he's almost as good as Daniel Day-Lewis in Lincoln.

If your not a F1 fan or from the 70's it may not be more than a blokes film, but give it a go it is going to end up being a important as Apollo 13 in the life of Mr Howard and quite frankly is by far the best car racing movie ever","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":459024,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-09-13","keywords":"formula 1,rivalry,1970s,racecar driver,nurburgring germany","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1998301465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNzA0MzkyNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQxNjAzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNzA0MzkyNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQxNjAzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"From Ron Howard comes an exhilarating true story of two legendary rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda, starring Chris Hemsworth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0117709/","name":"Daniel Brühl"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1165110/","name":"Chris Hemsworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1312575/","name":"Olivia Wilde"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234935/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0285648/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604948/","name":"Peter Morgan"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Les petits mouchoirs
Male nevine laži
programme.desc: Les petits mouchoirs: Directed by Guillaume Canet. With François Cluzet, Marion Cotillard, Benoît Magimel, Gilles Lellouche. A near-fatal accident leaves one friend in the hospital while the rest go on their annual vacation. But their secrets and personal grief threaten to drive them apart." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1440232/","name":"Les petits mouchoirs","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjIzMzVmN2YtM2VlOS00NTY3LWIwNDktODg4MzQ2MWRlOWJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjA0MzYwMDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A near-fatal accident leaves one friend in the hospital while the rest go on their annual vacation. But their secrets and personal grief threaten to drive them apart.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1440232/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rolivire-1"},"dateCreated":"2011-01-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the most realistic movies ever about the truth of life......","reviewBody":"Beautiful movie with topics and acting FAR ABOVE what we are used to get from the States (Hollywood). Most people in this movie of Canet are in their best years of their lives (and above the average if looking at their attractiveness)and meet on a holiday in Les Landes, south of France. Beautiful back ground music and (no French) songs coupled to nice realistic scenes of people which enjoy their holidays, but also have many disputes with their "friends". Acting is phenomenal!!All scenes within 2 and half hours watching are realistic and recognizable to the observer. The movie shows that people need each other to be able to have sex and make joy. If someone fells ill or is badly wounded as in this movie Ludo, he (or she) can shake it, because people tend to pay attention only to those which can offer them good company, joy or sex. Still there are some very friendly en good characters in this movie which offer people their attention without asking something in return. programme.title: Winchester
Kuća duhova
programme.desc: Winchester: Directed by Michael Spierig, Peter Spierig. With Helen Mirren, Sarah Snook, Finn Scicluna-O'Prey, Jason Clarke. Ensconced in her sprawling San Jose, California mansion, eccentric firearm heiress Sarah Winchester (Dame Helen Mirren) believes she is haunted by the souls of people killed by the Winchester repeating rifle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1072748/","name":"Winchester","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2OWE5OGItMTE4Yi00ZmIzLThjZDctNTU1OTMxMTc3Yjg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4NTM5NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ensconced in her sprawling San Jose, California mansion, eccentric firearm heiress Sarah Winchester (Dame Helen Mirren) believes she is haunted by the souls of people killed by the Winchester repeating rifle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1072748/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ehzimmerman"},"dateCreated":"2018-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprisingly cathartic","reviewBody":"For those who want factual history, "Captive of the Labyrinth" by Mary Jo Ignoffo is an excellent biography of Sarah Winchester, who probably was not interested in ghosts, but rather in architecture, a field that did not invite professional participation by women. Sarah Winchester's father manufactured decorative architectural features for Victorian houses, and his factory was right next door to her childhood home -- so Sarah grew up intimately exposed to the physical details of building houses. As an educated rich woman, building her house was an expensive hobby she loved and could afford to pursue. She also incorporated the newest technology - elevators, showers, etc. - into the house, and managed a productive fruit orchards and a dried fruit business, and . I thought the movie did a good job of including some factual information based on the real Sarah Winchester, and accurately portrayed her as responsible, not crazy, and deeply caring for her family, As for the lurid sensational haunted house story, this was concocted by those who bought the house after Sarah Winchester died, and turned it into a money-making tourist trap. That said, I enjoyed this fictional ghost story, which explored deeper themes than I would normally expect from a supernatural horror genre flick. There does seem to be a heavy handed message about gun violence -- however, I agree with that message; it's more than timely..","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":32994,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2018-02-02","keywords":"ghost,winchester house,widower,gothic horror,haunted house","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Tease","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2287974681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5MDA2NjE3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjEyMDEwNDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5MDA2NjE3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjEyMDEwNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"On an isolated stretch of land 50 miles outside of San Francisco sits the most haunted house in the world. Built by Sarah Winchester, heiress to the Winchester fortune, it is a house that knows no end. Constructed in an incessant twenty-four hour a day, seven day a week mania for decades, it stands seven stories tall and contains hundreds of rooms. To the outsider it looks like a monstrous monument to a disturbed woman's madness. But Sarah is not building for herself, for her niece or for the brilliant Doctor Eric Price whom she has summoned to the house. She is building a prison, an asylum for hundreds of vengeful ghosts, and the most terrifying among them have a score to settle with the Winchesters..."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000545/","name":"Helen Mirren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3512758/","name":"Sarah Snook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7073477/","name":"Finn Scicluna-O'Prey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294961/","name":"Michael Spierig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294962/","name":"Peter Spierig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047306/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0380601/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0215453/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1129343/","name":"Tom Vaughan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294961/","name":"Michael Spierig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294962/","name":"Peter Spierig"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Mercy
Samo more zna
programme.desc:
The Mercy: Directed by James Marsh. With Colin Firth, Eleanor Stagg, Rachel Weisz, Zara Prassinot. The incredible story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe. The struggles he confronted on the journey while his family awaited his return is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent times." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3319730/","name":"The Mercy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzODQ5NjA3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI4MjkxNDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The incredible story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe. The struggles he confronted on the journey while his family awaited his return is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3319730/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AlexLindh"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good movie, but still a big disappointment","reviewBody":"As many have mentioned before, the documentary "Deep Water" is better at telling the story than this film, but "The Mercy" still has its merits. The movie looks great for the most part in its 1960's setting, and the actors all do their jobs. I particularly liked David Thewlis and Rachel Weisz in their roles. Colin Firth is also good, but looks like a sad dog for much of the movie, even before his character gets into trouble in the beginning and eventually sets sail.

The movie almost rushes through the intro, with rapid speaking lines and stressed scenes that don't feel all that natural. This is actually a problem all the way through, as it never slows down enough for us to truly take in the isolation and loneliness that Donald Crowhurst (Colin Firth, that is) must have felt in real life. We spend too much time on land and too little time at sea. As with many other films, it's hard to translate human thoughts onto the big screen ("The Old Man and the Sea" must be the classic example of this), and "The Mercy" fails on this note more often than it succeeds.

I do, however, still recommend the film, because it is still a good movie with good actors, and it's worth watching. It's just a shame that it doesn't reach its full potential, with a fascinating story such as this one.

I haven't seen "Crowhurst" (produced at the same time as "The Mercy", but by a different studio), but I've heard that that one is a bit better. In the end, "Deep Water" seems to be the best choice, however.

UPDATE (8 November, 2018): I have now seen "Crowhurst", and I am not sure if it's better than "The Mercy". I gave both films six stars. They are very different, however, as "Crowhurst" is more of a low-budget, theatrical art house film. It is also a character study, rather than a story-driven movie. Because of this, I think both films are worth watching, for their own reasons. "Deep Water" tells the story better than either of them, however and is indeed the best choice to watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8297,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Adventure","Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-02-09","keywords":"boat race,boat,sailing,lost at sea,period drama","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi297383961","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NGFjNjktYmFkNi00YTU5LWIyNDgtOTllZTk5NmE4OTY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NGFjNjktYmFkNi00YTU5LWIyNDgtOTllZTk5NmE4OTY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Yachtsman Donald Crowhurst's disastrous attempt to win the 1968 Golden Globe Race ends up with him creating an outrageous account of traveling the world alone by sea."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000147/","name":"Colin Firth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5663632/","name":"Eleanor Stagg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001838/","name":"Rachel Weisz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1016428/","name":"James Marsh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010002/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1994243/","name":"Scott Z. Burns"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: I Care a Lot
Jako mi je stalo
programme.desc: I Care a Lot: Directed by J Blakeson. With Rosamund Pike, Peter Dinklage, Eiza González, Dianne Wiest. A crooked legal guardian who drains the savings of her elderly wards meets her match when a woman she tries to swindle turns out to be more than she first appears." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9893250/","name":"I Care a Lot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWU2ZTRhNDMtMWYxMC00ZTVkLThjZmItZGY4MGU0YmZlMjJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A crooked legal guardian who drains the savings of her elderly wards meets her match when a woman she tries to swindle turns out to be more than she first appears.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9893250/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"myspace-948-975450"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Most unsuccesful antihero ever","reviewBody":"This Marla character is just pure vile evil, in a bad way, nothing cunning or intelligent. The plot holes are just too annoying to ignore, it edges to simply terrible filmmaking. Acting is top notch, though, but the story and "non-antagonist antihero" aspect fail miserably.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":120507,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2021-02-19","keywords":"elder abuse,judge,safety deposit box,drugged,disguise","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1114947865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2MxY2NjN2QtYmFiOS00ZjU2LWFlZGQtODllNDA0ZDBmMzQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2MxY2NjN2QtYmFiOS00ZjU2LWFlZGQtODllNDA0ZDBmMzQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Poised with sharklike self-assurance, Marla Grayson (Rosamund Pike) is a professional, court-appointed guardian for dozens of elderly wards whose assets she seizes and cunningly bilks through dubious but legal means. It's a well-oiled racket that Marla and her business-partner and lover Fran (Eiza González) use with brutal efficiency on their latest "cherry," Jennifer Peterson (Dianne Wiest) - a wealthy retiree with no living heirs or family. But when their mark turns out to have an equally shady secret of her own and connections to a volatile gangster (Peter Dinklage), Marla is forced to level up in a game only predators can play - one that's neither fair, nor square."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0683253/","name":"Rosamund Pike"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0227759/","name":"Peter Dinklage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2555462/","name":"Eiza González"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2128335/","name":"J Blakeson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319513/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0767489/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0699213/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2128335/","name":"J Blakeson"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 12 Strong
12 hrabrih
programme.desc:
12 Strong: Directed by Nicolai Fuglsig. With Chris Hemsworth, Michael Shannon, Michael Peña, Navid Negahban. 12 Strong tells the story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11; under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1413492/","name":"12 Strong","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTEzMjk3NzkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjY2NDczNDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"12 Strong tells the story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11; under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1413492/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mat-fletcher"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Decent retelling of a true story almost too good to be true","reviewBody":"But it is true, this really did happen. Obviously the movie makes some artistic, social and political changes but it seems like a mostly faithful retelling of the story.

Now, true story aside, the movie itself was very enjoyable, the actors made believable SF soldiers, the locations, the equipment, everything looked good.

I am so glad that they did not make a Lone Survivor clone, this is a movie that can stand up in it´s own.

Some other reviews here are saying that they are disappointed that it is predictable story. I suppose that they don´t realise that it is a true story, such is the epic and frankly absurd bravery of these men in the field, it´s almost too good to be true. 

It´s a great story and it is well told in this movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":75358,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2018-01-19","keywords":"taliban,afghanistan,post 9 11,bravery,us military","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2478815257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWE2NzAwNTctN2JlYS00ZTVlLThhZTEtYTU5ZDc0ZWY1Y2VkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWE2NzAwNTctN2JlYS00ZTVlLThhZTEtYTU5ZDc0ZWY1Y2VkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"'12 Strong' tells the story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11; under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1165110/","name":"Chris Hemsworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0788335/","name":"Michael Shannon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0671567/","name":"Michael Peña"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3350420/","name":"Nicolai Fuglsig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054452/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410488/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026281/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0848217/","name":"Ted Tally"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0185976/","name":"Peter Craig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3066678/","name":"Doug Stanton"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paranoia
Paranoja
programme.desc:
Paranoia: Directed by Robert Luketic. With Liam Hemsworth, Gary Oldman, Amber Heard, Harrison Ford. An entry-level employee at a powerful corporation finds himself occupying a corner office, but at a dangerous price: he must spy on his boss's old mentor to secure for him a multi-billion dollar advantage." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1413495/","name":"Paranoia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNjYwMTYwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDA4NTc2OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An entry-level employee at a powerful corporation finds himself occupying a corner office, but at a dangerous price: he must spy on his boss's old mentor to secure for him a multi-billion dollar advantage.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1413495/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"darkbartlon"},"dateCreated":"2014-01-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A lot of potential not really developed in this sloppy film about two rival tech corporations","reviewBody":"A thriller about the dark world of tech business giants, with big shot start like Gary Oldman and Harrison Ford, what could go wrong, right? Well, with this movie, almost everything did. It's slow, boring, repetitive and overall just disappointing.

Adam (Liam Hensworth) is a programmer (I think, because character development apparently wasn't a priority in this movie) who gets stuck in the middle of a feud between two tech giants, Wyatt and Goddard, played by Gary Oldman and Harrison Ford. And that's about as deep as the story goes. There's some background as to the rivalry between Wyatt and Goddard and a hard-to-believe love story between Adam and one of Goddard's executives, but overall, the film feels like an unfinished job, with a lot of potential, but no real charm to it.

I've got to accept the movie has some good things worth mentioning. Gary Oldman is great, as expected, in his limited screen time, and the final scenes are actually pretty good, but all in all this was not a good movie, and I would not recommend it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36441,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-08-16","keywords":"spying,thumbprint,traffic,man wears a swimsuit,man wrapped in a towel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3075778073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyODQ4NTc5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ4NjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyODQ4NTc5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ4NjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The two most powerful tech billionaires in the world are bitter rivals with a complicated past. When a young new superstar, seduced by unlimited wealth and power falls between them, he becomes trapped in the middle of their life-and-death game of corporate espionage.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2955013/","name":"Liam Hemsworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000198/","name":"Gary Oldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000148/","name":"Harrison Ford"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525659/","name":"Robert Luketic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0336601/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0317576/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355699/","name":"Jason Hall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1633356/","name":"Barry L. Levy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277511/","name":"Joseph Finder"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1413495, Title: Paranoia, --- Description: Paranoia: Directed by Robert Luketic. With Liam Hemsworth, Gary Oldman, Amber Heard, Harrison Ford. An entry-level employee at a powerful corporation finds himself occupying a corner office, but at a dangerous price: he must spy on his boss's old mentor to secure for him a multi-billion dollar advantage." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1413495/","name":"Paranoia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNjYwMTYwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDA4NTc2OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An entry-level employee at a powerful corporation finds himself occupying a corner office, but at a dangerous price: he must spy on his boss's old mentor to secure for him a multi-billion dollar advantage.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1413495/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"darkbartlon","dateCreated":"2014-01-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A lot of potential not really developed in this sloppy film about two rival tech corporations","reviewBody":"A thriller about the dark world of tech business giants, with big shot start like Gary Oldman and Harrison Ford, what could go wrong, right? Well, with this movie, almost everything did. It's slow, boring, repetitive and overall just disappointing.

Adam (Liam Hensworth) is a programmer (I think, because character development apparently wasn't a priority in this movie) who gets stuck in the middle of a feud between two tech giants, Wyatt and Goddard, played by Gary Oldman and Harrison Ford. And that's about as deep as the story goes. There's some background as to the rivalry between Wyatt and Goddard and a hard-to-believe love story between Adam and one of Goddard's executives, but overall, the film feels like an unfinished job, with a lot of potential, but no real charm to it.

I've got to accept the movie has some good things worth mentioning. Gary Oldman is great, as expected, in his limited screen time, and the final scenes are actually pretty good, but all in all this was not a good movie, and I would not recommend it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36441,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-08-16","keywords":"spying,thumbprint,traffic,man wears a swimsuit,man wrapped in a towel","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3075778073","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyODQ4NTc5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ4NjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyODQ4NTc5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ4NjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The two most powerful tech billionaires in the world are bitter rivals with a complicated past. A homeschooled teenager begins to suspect her mother is keeping a dark secret from her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8633478/","name":"Run","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjdmZDlkMzItNTg0OS00MjAxLWE0ZTQtZjdhOWM1MTJkOTc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homeschooled teenager begins to suspect her mother is keeping a dark secret from her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8633478/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Neon_Gold"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really Fun and Well Made","reviewBody":"This was such a good thriller. I think it was one of the most effective ones that i have seen this year.

It was defiantly a fun, hour and a half popcorn fun movie but i think it was just that little bit extra too. The filmmaking was above that for me. It just had that little bit of extra care put into it and i think it made all the difference.

The acting was really great from both of the leads. I was really impressed with Kiera Allen. This was her debut film and i think this will net her even more roles because she was fantastic.

I found the score really great too. It really worked together with the script and filmmaking to really get you into the film. I appreciated it.

You should definitely watch this, its really fun, supper quick and well made.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":62933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-11-20","keywords":"revenge,kidnapping,villainess played by lead actress,mother daughter relationship,child abduction","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1238024473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2EwOWRkMjAtNmRiOS00MTY5LTgxZmMtNDc5OGM4MDVhYmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2EwOWRkMjAtNmRiOS00MTY5LTgxZmMtNDc5OGM4MDVhYmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homeschooled teenager begins to suspect her mother is keeping a dark secret from her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005299/","name":"Sarah Paulson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6266674/","name":"Kiera Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3337639/","name":"Sara Sohn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3792134/","name":"Aneesh Chaganty"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3792134/","name":"Aneesh Chaganty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3539578/","name":"Sev Ohanian"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Centering on a handful of people as they navigate the obstacles currently hindering society: disease, martial law, quarantine, and vigilantes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12592252/","name":"Songbird","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDA1MTYxNjctYjQyOS00OTQ2LWFkNGMtMmZkNDg0ZDNjNDYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY1MTg4Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 2024 a pandemic ravages the world and its cities. Centering on a handful of people as they navigate the obstacles currently hindering society: disease, martial law, quarantine, and vigilantes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12592252/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gonzo-11107"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth a watch.","reviewBody":"Apparently everyone is a top tier film critic these days. This movie has its ups and downs, but all in all, it's not as bad a movie as everyone has said. It shows how things could be handled if covid got out of hand and I think it does it pretty well considering it takes place in the U. S. if you're looking for a movie to pop on, this is a pretty good one. No need to over analyze everything in the movie, it's not that big a deal.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8912,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-12-11","keywords":"delivery man,2020s,pandemic,quarantine,courier","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1508884761","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODM1OGE5NjMtZTgxMy00OGRiLTk1OWQtMWJmMjQ5NjgxZWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODM1OGE5NjMtZTgxMy00OGRiLTk1OWQtMWJmMjQ5NjgxZWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four years into quarantine the virus has changed and so have we... \n \nThe COVID-23 virus has mutated and the world is in its fourth year of lockdown. Infected Americans are ripped from their homes and forced into quarantine camps known as Q-Zones, from which there is no escape, as a few brave souls fight back against the forces of oppression. programme.title: Scandalous: The Untold Story of the National Enquirer
Skandalozno: Neispričana priča National Enquirera
programme.desc: Scandalous: The Untold Story of the National Enquirer: Directed by Mark Landsman. With Ken Auletta, Malcolm Balfour, Carl Bernstein, Tony Brenna. 'Scandalous' is the sensational true story of The National Enquirer, the infamous tabloid with a prescient grasp of its readers' darkest curiosities." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10844816/","name":"Scandalous: The Untold Story of the National Enquirer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjMxZmQ2OTktZTk4Ny00MjViLWI2YzMtNGZiNjhmMjNjMTFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Scandalous' is the sensational true story of The National Enquirer, the infamous tabloid with a prescient grasp of its readers' darkest curiosities.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10844816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wyellen"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"CNN bashes Trump via National Enquirer documentary","reviewBody":"This CNN creation does have some interesting material about the creation of the National Enquirer and it's history. However, after lulling the audience for a while with it's supposed central theme of NE history they get to the real meat of the matter pushing the narrative that the Enquirer had become a right wing publication and was very responsible for Donald Trump's election. It has hilarious moral platitudes from people like Carl Bernstein talking with a straight face about how awful the Enquirer had forsaken journalist standards of objectivity by demonstrating conservative political bias. As with Trump, many interesting facts about the editor-owner Generoso Pope Jr. that would cast him in a positive light were simply left out. While Pope had mob connections he attended the Horace Mann School and earned an engineering degree from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in electrical engineering; and was a Korean War vet. Getting a degree from MIT in electrical engineering, especially in those days, represented a intellectual feat that few can accomplish.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":449,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2019-11-15","keywords":"tabloid","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2996616985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzYzNmYxODgtOGRjNC00NzZiLWE1YzItNzA5MGIxZDFkYmI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzYzNmYxODgtOGRjNC00NzZiLWE1YzItNzA5MGIxZDFkYmI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Scandalous' is the sensational true story of The National Enquirer, the infamous tabloid with a prescient grasp of its readers darkest curiosities."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1885286/","name":"Ken Auletta"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11680628/","name":"Malcolm Balfour"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077012/","name":"Carl Bernstein"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0485153/","name":"Mark Landsman"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Africa Mia
programme.desc: Africa Mia: Directed by Richard Minier, Edouard Salier. 1964. In the midst of the Cold War, ten young promising musicians from Mali are sent to Cuba to study music and strengthen cultural links between the two socialist regimes. They invent a whole new genre: Afro- Cuban Music and become the iconic group 'Las Maravillas de Mali'. New Year's Eve 2000. Iza zatvorenih vrata
programme.desc: Songbird: Directed by Adam Mason. With K.J. Apa, Sofia Carson, Craig Robinson, Bradley Whitford. In 2024 a pandemic ravages the world and its cities. Centering on a handful of people as they navigate the obstacles currently hindering society: disease, martial law, quarantine, and vigilantes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12592252/","name":"Songbird","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDA1MTYxNjctYjQyOS00OTQ2LWFkNGMtMmZkNDg0ZDNjNDYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY1MTg4Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 2024 a pandemic ravages the world and its cities. Centering on a handful of people as they navigate the obstacles currently hindering society: disease, martial law, quarantine, and vigilantes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12592252/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gonzo-11107"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth a watch.","reviewBody":"Apparently everyone is a top tier film critic these days. This movie has its ups and downs, but all in all, it's not as bad a movie as everyone has said. It shows how things could be handled if covid got out of hand and I think it does it pretty well considering it takes place in the U. S. if you're looking for a movie to pop on, this is a pretty good one. Infected Americans are ripped from their homes and forced into quarantine camps known as Q-Zones, from which there is no escape, as a few brave souls fight back against the forces of oppression. Amid this dystopian landscape, a fearless courier, Nico (KJ Apa), who's immune to the deadly pathogen, finds hope and love with Sara (Sofia Carson), though her lockdown prohibits them from physical contact. When Sara is believed to have become infected, Nico races desperately across the barren streets of Los Angeles in search of the only thing that can save her from imprisonment ... or worse."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6216001/","name":"K.J. programme.title: Scandalous: The Untold Story of the National Enquirer
Skandalozno: Neispričana priča National Enquirera
programme.desc: Scandalous: The Untold Story of the National Enquirer: Directed by Mark Landsman. With Ken Auletta, Malcolm Balfour, Carl Bernstein, Tony Brenna. 'Scandalous' is the sensational true story of The National Enquirer, the infamous tabloid with a prescient grasp of its readers' darkest curiosities." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10844816/","name":"Scandalous: The Untold Story of the National Enquirer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjMxZmQ2OTktZTk4Ny00MjViLWI2YzMtNGZiNjhmMjNjMTFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Scandalous' is the sensational true story of The National Enquirer, the infamous tabloid with a prescient grasp of its readers' darkest curiosities.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10844816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wyellen"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"CNN bashes Trump via National Enquirer documentary","reviewBody":"This CNN creation does have some interesting material about the creation of the National Enquirer and it's history. However, after lulling the audience for a while with it's supposed central theme of NE history they get to the real meat of the matter pushing the narrative that the Enquirer had become a right wing publication and was very responsible for Donald Trump's election. It has hilarious moral platitudes from people like Carl Bernstein talking with a straight face about how awful the Enquirer had forsaken journalist standards of objectivity by demonstrating conservative political bias. As with Trump, many interesting facts about the editor-owner Generoso Pope Jr. that would cast him in a positive light were simply left out. While Pope had mob connections he attended the Horace Mann School and earned an engineering degree from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in electrical engineering; and was a Korean War vet. Getting a degree from MIT in electrical engineering, especially in those days, represented a intellectual feat that few can accomplish.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":449,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2019-11-15","keywords":"tabloid","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2996616985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzYzNmYxODgtOGRjNC00NzZiLWE1YzItNzA5MGIxZDFkYmI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzYzNmYxODgtOGRjNC00NzZiLWE1YzItNzA5MGIxZDFkYmI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Scandalous' is the sensational true story of The National Enquirer, the infamous tabloid with a prescient grasp of its readers darkest curiosities."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1885286/","name":"Ken Auletta"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11680628/","name":"Malcolm Balfour"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077012/","name":"Carl Bernstein"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0485153/","name":"Mark Landsman"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Odvedi me na lijepo mjesto
programme.desc: ODVEDI ME NA LIJEPO MJESTO distopijski je film o tajanstvenoj obitelji u umirućem svijetu koja uništi ono malo ljudskosti što joj je preostalo kako bi stvorila svoju uvrnutu, ali idiličnu budućnost. Nakon što se čovječanstvo samo dovelo na rub izumiranja, jedan gorljivi preživjeli usamljenik probija se kanadskim bespućem u potrazi za znanjem i sredstvima s ciljem preoblikovanja čovječanstva. Deset godina poslije žena podiže desetero djece iste dobi te ih priprema na žrtve koje će morati podnijeti kako bi spasili ljudsku vrstu.

programme.title: Mirna zemlja, dobri ljudi
programme.desc: Sybille, ravnateljica škole i političarka, nalazi se usred predizborne kampanje za predsjednika općinskog vijeća u svom švicarskom selu kada razredna kolegica optuži njezina sina za zlostavljanje.... Sybille, ravnateljica škole i političarka, nalazi se usred predizborne kampanje za predsjednika općinskog vijeća u svom švicarskom selu kada razredna kolegica optuži njezina sina za zlostavljanje. Sybille mora birati između morala i karijere. Bilo kako bilo, u pitanju je njezin ugled u zajednici!

programme.title: The Way Back
Izvan igre
programme.desc:
The Way Back: Directed by Gavin O'Connor. With Ben Affleck, Al Madrigal, Janina Gavankar, Michaela Watkins. Jack Cunningham was a high school basketball phenom who walked away from the game, forfeiting his future. Years later, when he reluctantly accepts a coaching job at his alma mater, he may get one last shot at redemption." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8544498/","name":"The Way Back","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBjMTgyYzktN2U0Mi00YTJhLThkZDQtZmM1ZDlmNWMwZDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jack Cunningham was a high school basketball phenom who walked away from the game, forfeiting his future. Years later, when he reluctantly accepts a coaching job at his alma mater, he may get one last shot at redemption.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8544498/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"keithsealy"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well acted, but predictable","reviewBody":"The dialog, acting, the characters, production value, etc. of this movie were excellent. It is a very honest representation of a man suffering with grief and alcoholism.

However, it suffers from being a retread of many other similar movies. You can trace the story arc easily and predict what will happen throughout. You also shouldn't go into this movie thinking it is a 'sports' movie, while basketball coaching serves as a vehicle of redemption, you could have written the same movie about someone taking a job teaching a class or working with special needs kids.

Finally, be warned that this is a very 'heavy' movie. There are a few lighter scenes, but >80% of the movie is dramatic and played for an emotional punch.

Worth a watch for Affeck's performance.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41173,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"2020-03-06","keywords":"alcoholism,basketball movie,basketball coach,cemetery,underdog","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2639839001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWIzYmVkY2QtNTZlMy00MzE4LWE3NDktZWEzMGE2MjZmZmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWIzYmVkY2QtNTZlMy00MzE4LWE3NDktZWEzMGE2MjZmZmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jack Cunningham (Ben Affleck) once had a life filled with promise. In high school, he was a basketball phenom with a full university scholarship, when suddenly, for reasons unknown, he walked away from the game, forfeiting his future. Now years later, Jack is spiralling down, triggered by an unspeakable loss, and drowning in the alcoholism that cost him his marriage and any hope for a better life. When he is asked to coach the basketball team at his alma mater, which has fallen far since his glory days, he reluctantly accepts, surprising no one more than himself. As the boys start to come together as a team and win, Jack may have finally found a reason to confront the demons that have derailed him. But will it be enough to fill the void, heal the deep wounds of his past, and set him on the road to redemption?"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000255/","name":"Ben Affleck"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1371339/","name":"Al Madrigal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1232470/","name":"Janina Gavankar"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0640334/","name":"Gavin O'Connor"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0706942/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2145487/","name":"Brad Ingelsby"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ex Machina
Ex Machina
programme.desc: Ex Machina: Directed by Alex Garland. With Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander, Oscar Isaac, Sonoya Mizuno. A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0470752/","name":"Ex Machina","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNzc0OTIxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI3NzU2NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0470752/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jim-Eadon"},"dateCreated":"2015-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Intelligent Movie","reviewBody":"This movie is obviously allegorical, a fascinating tale about AI, but it is mainly about manipulation and power. It isn't for those wanting action or spectacular CGI, the movie is aimed at people who like to think, rather than passively wait to be entertained. There are themes here not only about AI, but also about surveillance, with excellent points about how data about us is collected by phone companies, search engine companies, commercial operating systems makers and so on. The plot seems simple but isn't, it's extremely clever, with the protagonist playing games, trying to stay one step ahead of one another. This is a movie with perfectly consistent internal logic that plays out perfectly. Don't go in expecting too much, however, as I can see most people will not be satisfied by this movie, but for me, it does what it sets out to do brilliantly. Therefore I give at least 9/10. And most recent movies have been getting 5/10 from me. This movie succeeds where another recent movie about AI, Transcendence, I think it is called, failed (but it was an interesting failure). A third movie about AI, a Spanish movie called Eva, was also brilliant. Eva was more moving and this movie more philosophical. But both movies were perfect in their different ways. The AI's name in this movie, Ava, seems to be a nod to the title of the Spanish movie. As an aside, it's nice that no "stars" appeared in "Ex Machina" and "Eva", the casting was great. Of course there are several aspects of this movie that are unrealistic and often absurd. But because this is an allegorical movie, these are acceptable, because the movie is making points, rather than striving for realism. It's more of a fairytale than accurate portrayal.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":511079,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2015-01-21","keywords":"artificial intelligence,turing test,minimal cast,robot,robot human relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi744337689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyMjQzNzk0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE4NjM0NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyMjQzNzk0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE4NjM0NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young programmer is selected to participate in a breakthrough experiment in artificial intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a breathtaking female A.I.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2539953/","name":"Alicia Vikander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1727304/","name":"Domhnall Gleeson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1209966/","name":"Oscar Isaac"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0307497/","name":"Alex Garland"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0390816/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0307497/","name":"Alex Garland"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Full Monty
Skidajte se do kraja
programme.desc:
The Full Monty: Directed by Peter Cattaneo. With Robert Carlyle, Mark Addy, Wim Snape, Steve Huison. Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119164/","name":"The Full Monty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg0NWFjMTAtNGZjMC00NmZlLThhZDYtM2MzNTU2NDZiZDVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDUyOTUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119164/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"artistathome"},"dateCreated":"2006-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great movie","reviewBody":"This is an unbeatable movie! I saw it at the theater in 1997 along with about 7 other women...we all went to the theater alone because our hubbies refused to take us! Seriously...I did not know one single woman in the theater that day! We all loved the movie right off...

My sister bought it and we watched it with captioning, and boy had we missed a lot of lines at the theater and funny ones at that! You see with the English accents and all their slang-- you just can't understand a lot of what they are saying...

Watch this movie with and without the captioning! It's like watching a movie with English being your second language, and I B.S. you not!

The English working class has a different way of expressing themselves--its so charming and hilarious...

I think Robert Carlysle is brilliant "Gaz". I cannot think of anyone who could have done it better. 

This movie cannot be beat! I bought it and recommend it to everyone!! Definitely a ten out of ten."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":103657,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1997-08-29","keywords":"unemployment,male stripper,northern england,working class,england","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Full Monty","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi395116825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWJhOTk1ZjQtOGQyMC00NzcxLTg1ZTctYjA3ZTllMzA1MmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWJhOTk1ZjQtOGQyMC00NzcxLTg1ZTctYjA3ZTllMzA1MmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Fox Searchlight Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001015/","name":"Robert Carlyle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004692/","name":"Mark Addy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146341/","name":"Peter Cattaneo"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065001/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064479/","name":"Simon Beaufoy"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Way Back
Izvan igre
programme.desc:
The Way Back: Directed by Gavin O'Connor. With Ben Affleck, Al Madrigal, Janina Gavankar, Michaela Watkins. Jack Cunningham was a high school basketball phenom who walked away from the game, forfeiting his future. Years later, when he reluctantly accepts a coaching job at his alma mater, he may get one last shot at redemption." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8544498/","name":"The Way Back","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBjMTgyYzktN2U0Mi00YTJhLThkZDQtZmM1ZDlmNWMwZDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jack Cunningham was a high school basketball phenom who walked away from the game, forfeiting his future. Years later, when he reluctantly accepts a coaching job at his alma mater, he may get one last shot at redemption.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8544498/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"keithsealy"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well acted, but predictable","reviewBody":"The dialog, acting, the characters, production value, etc. of this movie were excellent. It is a very honest representation of a man suffering with grief and alcoholism.

However, it suffers from being a retread of many other similar movies. You can trace the story arc easily and predict what will happen throughout. You also shouldn't go into this movie thinking it is a 'sports' movie, while basketball coaching serves as a vehicle of redemption, you could have written the same movie about someone taking a job teaching a class or working with special needs kids.

Finally, be warned that this is a very 'heavy' movie. There are a few lighter scenes, but >80% of the movie is dramatic and played for an emotional punch.

In high school, he was a basketball phenom with a full university scholarship, when suddenly, for reasons unknown, he walked away from the game, forfeiting his future. Now years later, Jack is spiralling down, triggered by an unspeakable loss, and drowning in the alcoholism that cost him his marriage and any hope for a better life. When he is asked to coach the basketball team at his alma mater, which has fallen far since his glory days, he reluctantly accepts, surprising no one more than himself. As the boys start to come together as a team and win, Jack may have finally found a reason to confront the demons that have derailed him. But will it be enough to fill the void, heal the deep wounds of his past, and set him on the road to redemption?"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000255/","name":"Ben Affleck"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1371339/","name":"Al Madrigal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1232470/","name":"Janina Gavankar"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0640334/","name":"Gavin O'Connor"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0706942/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2145487/","name":"Brad Ingelsby"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

It is a very honest representation of a man suffering with grief and alcoholism.

However, it suffers from being a retread of many other similar movies. You can trace the story arc easily and predict what will happen throughout. You also shouldn't go into this movie thinking it is a 'sports' movie, while basketball coaching serves as a vehicle of redemption, you could have written the same movie about someone taking a job teaching a class or working with special needs kids.

Finally, be warned that this is a very 'heavy' movie. There are a few lighter scenes, but >80% of the movie is dramatic and played for an emotional punch.
