When the daughter of a well-known and well-respected base commander is murdered, an undercover detective is summoned to look into the matter and finds a slew of cover-ups at West Point." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0144214/","name":"The General's Daughter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzY3NDQ2YzctMTY1MC00NzkwLWJmNzctMDgzZWI1OWY5MDhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When the daughter of a well-known and well-respected base commander is murdered, an undercover detective is summoned to look into the matter and finds a slew of cover-ups at West Point.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0144214/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Hey_Sweden"},"dateCreated":"2015-02-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Slick and engrossing.","reviewBody":"John Travolta stars as Paul Brenner, a charismatic man in the Army's C.I.D. unit. Paul is called upon to solve the strange rape & murder of the title character, Elizabeth Campbell (Leslie Stefanson). Paul gets paired with a rape investigator named Sara Sunhill (Madeleine Stowe), who just happens to be a former flame of his. As Paul and Sara work the clues, they discover a string of characters who all have their secrets to hide. And it becomes apparent that the Army's main concern is keeping things quiet and maintaining the public image.

While far from a great story, this is still an absorbing one. There's a very tragic and somber arc that stems from the Elizabeth Campbell character being a *very* troubled individual. The story isn't always too believable, but director Simon West keeps the plot progressing in competent enough fashion, with a couple of twists along the way. The more serious and sordid elements are sometimes contrasted with not terribly amusing banter between Travolta and Stowe.

The exemplary supporting cast is the main reason to watch. Travolta lays on the goofy charm a bit much at first (and does a deliberately bad Southern accent for too long a time), but as the movie goes on, the better his performance gets. He and Stowe are able to create some chemistry. Stefanson is effective as the victim, and James Cromwell as her general father is completely convincing. Clarence Williams III also scores strongly as the generals' comrade, who's loyal to the core. The real standout is the always dynamic James Woods, as Elizabeths' mentor; the scenes where he and Travolta are attempting to outwit each other are just about the best in the movie.

Well shot (by Peter Menzies Jr.) and decently paced, "The General's Daughter" manages to be watchable for a little under two hours.

Seven out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":57618,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1999-10-06","keywords":"army,cover up,murder,rape,military","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The General's Daughter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1508549657","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDZhZDJiODEtNDBjNC00NTUxLWE1ZWMtMGQ3N2IxYzkzZjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDZhZDJiODEtNDBjNC00NTUxLWE1ZWMtMGQ3N2IxYzkzZjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The General's Daughter"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000237/","name":"John Travolta"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000656/","name":"Madeleine Stowe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000342/","name":"James Cromwell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0922346/","name":"Simon West"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075914/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067370/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0218491/","name":"Nelson DeMille"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0078203/","name":"Christopher Bertolini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001279/","name":"William Goldman"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

As a refreshing change to more formulaic chillers, WLB takes its time to build the suspense. It is allowed to do this by virtue of Harrison Ford, and, especially, Michelle Pfeiffer, who, I feel, deserved an Oscar nomination for her convincing portrayal of a happy, but suddenly lonely, wife. It is just about as Hitchcockian as you can get, and I rate the bath sequence as gripping (pardon the pun) as taking a shower at the Bates Motel. The plot is thin and the action is played out sedately. Yet it seems perfectly timed in setting the mood of the whole piece. I particularly liked the music,and the supporting actress Diana Scarwid, whose lighthearted attitude during the seance scene made it all the more chilling. A perfect example of good film-making with only a slight plot. I am sure this movie will mature with age until it is rightfully regarded as a modern classic. Count the number of times you jump!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":122856,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2000-10-18","keywords":"hitchcockian,death by drowning,small village,pick up truck,entity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"What Lies Beneath","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1004667161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmMxMzhiM2MtY2U4YS00NGVjLWI3YTYtYTgwODM2M2JhN2IzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmMxMzhiM2MtY2U4YS00NGVjLWI3YTYtYTgwODM2M2JhN2IzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Dreamworks"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000148/","name":"Harrison Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0870007/","name":"Katharine Towne"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038131/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0163988/","name":"Clark Gregg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0449576/","name":"Sarah Kernochan"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Red Corner
Crveni ugao
programme.desc:
Red Corner: Directed by Jon Avnet. With Richard Gere, Bai Ling, Bradley Whitford, Byron Mann. An American attorney on business in China is wrongfully arrested and put on trial for murder, with a female defense lawyer from the country the only key to proving his innocence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119994/","name":"Red Corner","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzE0MjU5NzQxNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzQzNzU2NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An American attorney on business in China is wrongfully arrested and put on trial for murder, with a female defense lawyer from the country the only key to proving his innocence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119994/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"trpdean"},"dateCreated":"2004-07-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very good, exciting, exotic suspense thriller","reviewBody":"I thought this was wonderful - and can't for the life of me understand the criticisms. 

Some seem to be attacking the movie on the basis that it is too hard on China - REALLY? 

Ask any North Korean refugee who's been captured in China -

 Ask any member of the harmless Falun Gong religious sect -

Ask anyone connected by family ties with those identified as having participated in the Tianenmen Square protests (the protests were actually in quite a number of cities - but television covered just the tens of thousands assembled in Beijing). 

No, it's not an "art house" kind of movie - don't expect the slow pace and strange story of something like Farewell My Concubine.

 Instead, it's a wonderful Hitchcock-type story transplanted to Communist China - and voila - a wonderful movie that should have been remembered at Oscar time! 

It's far better than, say, Hitchcock's Torn Curtain or Topaz - both set in repressive Communist regimes. It's more like a combination of The Wrong Man and North by Northwest - but sexier than either.

Our Welsh friend from beautiful Aberystwyth, Philip Davies, has it about right in his review printed beneath mine.

This is beautifully shot, with wonderful acting in a riveting Hitchcock type movie. Richard Gere is excellent - the politics and scenes of a changing China are fascinating.

I strongly recommend this one. 

This is very exciting, suspenseful, romantic - and its depiction of China rings true."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16998,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1997-10-31","keywords":"topless female nudity,female full rear nudity,assassination attempt,color in title,searching for the truth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Red Corner","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3131311385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWY1NzViMjQtMTM1MS00Y2Q3LWE5ZjQtOTVjYWI3NzBmYWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWY1NzViMjQtMTM1MS00Y2Q3LWE5ZjQtOTVjYWI3NzBmYWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from MGM"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000152/","name":"Richard Gere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000499/","name":"Bai Ling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0925966/","name":"Bradley Whitford"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000816/","name":"Jon Avnet"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0006702/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0455207/","name":"Robert King"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dark Tide
Mračna plima
programme.desc: Dark Tide: Directed by John Stockwell. With Halle Berry, Olivier Martinez, Sizwe Msutu, Mark Elderkin. A professional diver tutor returns to deep waters after 1 year, following an almost fatal encounter with a great white shark. The nightmare from the deep is still lurking - more carnivorous and hungry than ever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1507563/","name":"Dark Tide","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTUxOTc3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDkwOTgzNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A professional diver tutor returns to deep waters after 1 year, following an almost fatal encounter with a great white shark. The nightmare from the deep is still lurking - more carnivorous and hungry than ever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1507563/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Leaves you with a certain sinking feeling...","reviewBody":"This isn't as dreadful as I had feared - it is actually, partially, redeemed by some really excellent underwater photography - and a suitably satisfactory denouement. Halle Berry is a diver whose on/off boyfriend Olivier Martinez manages to coax her into taking an arrogant, wealthy, Brit and his son on a cruise to swim with sharks. The story is poor, predictable and very slow to develop. Far too much of the jeopardy is created not from the sharks but from the rather odious millionaire Brit; his son and the two leads' rather tiresome are they/aren't they relationship - and, it appears that Berry has some history with sharks that resulted in her having had a near death experience. The dive footage of the sharks would have made for an interesting documentary on apex predators; the story ought just to have been shredded at birth...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8775,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-04-12","keywords":"shark,jelly fish,touching a shark,can of beer,spear gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Exclusive Premiere","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2116264217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2ODQ2NDgwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzA5ODgzNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2ODQ2NDgwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzA5ODgzNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the exclusive trailer premiere for the new thriller starring Halle Berry and Olivier Martinez, available via video on demand 3/8 and in theaters 3/30."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000932/","name":"Halle Berry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0553648/","name":"Olivier Martinez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114460/","name":"Ralph Brown"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007082/","name":"John Stockwell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0295380/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0291625/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0345025/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3602980/","name":"Amy Sorlie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159892/","name":"Ronnie Christensen"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Blow
Beli prah
programme.desc:
Blow: Directed by Ted Demme. With Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Franka Potente, Rachel Griffiths. The story of how George Jung, along with the Medellín Cartel headed by Pablo Escobar, established the American cocaine market in the 1970s in the United States." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0221027/","name":"Blow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjg5ZDkzZWEtZDQ2ZC00Y2ViLThhMzYtMmIxZDYzYTY2Y2Y2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODAwMTU1MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of how George Jung, along with the Medellín Cartel headed by Pablo Escobar, established the American cocaine market in the 1970s in the United States.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0221027/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Quinoa1984"},"dateCreated":"2001-04-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cocaine, They Started that. Your Welcome.","reviewBody":"That statement was said by Denis Leary who, not surprisingly, co-produced this drug epic with Ted Demme who not only directs this film, but Leary's special No Cure for Cancer. Watching that special, I would've never expected a movie this good and serious, but it is. And unless a better film comes along this year, Blow might just be the best film of 2001.

In this bio-pic, George Jung is a guy who starts out by selling pot in the California area. After a while though, he progresses to selling cocaine in the late 70's and early 80's with the infamous Pablo Ecobar, and becomes a multi-millionaire (Jung, played by Jonny Depp very well, explains that if you bought cocaine in that time period in America, there would be a 85 percent chance it was from him). But then we see how things change with time, especially with Jung, which makes this movie even more fascinating and excellent.

While Blow is stylish, smart and hard edged with good stuff, the film also has compassion and feeling, in-particular in the third act which gives this movie a clever turn. Also with brilliant acting from the cast (the ensemble includes Depp, Paul Ruebens, Penelope Cruz and in a twist of a role from GoodFellas, Ray Liotta as Jung's dad) and a well told story, this is one of the best bio-pics and drug movies of the 00's.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":250534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2001-04-06","keywords":"drug abuse,nosebleed,police officer,drug cartel,united states","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blow","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3504603417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUyMmUwMWQtYWFkZC00YTAxLWJiNjUtMTA0NzY0OTZlMGFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUyMmUwMWQtYWFkZC00YTAxLWJiNjUtMTA0NzY0OTZlMGFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000136/","name":"Johnny Depp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004851/","name":"Penélope Cruz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004376/","name":"Franka Potente"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001130/","name":"Ted Demme"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072799/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028247/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0692051/","name":"Bruce Porter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0571346/","name":"David McKenna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001024/","name":"Nick Cassavetes"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0221027, Title: Blow, --- Description: Blow: Directed by Ted Demme. With Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Franka Potente, Rachel Griffiths. The story of how George Jung, along with the Medellín Cartel headed by Pablo Escobar, established the American cocaine market in the 1970s in the United States." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0221027/","name":"Blow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjg5ZDkzZWEtZDQ2ZC00Y2ViLThhMzYtMmIxZDYzYTY2Y2Y2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODAwMTU1MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of how George Jung, along with the Medellín Cartel headed by Pablo Escobar, established the American cocaine market in the 1970s in the United States.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0221027/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Quinoa1984","dateCreated":"2001-04-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cocaine, They Started that. Your Welcome.","reviewBody":"That statement was said by Denis Leary who, not surprisingly, co-produced this drug epic with Ted Demme who not only directs this film, but Leary's special No Cure for Cancer. Watching that special, I would've never expected a movie this good and serious, but it is. And unless a better film comes along this year, Blow might just be the best film of 2001.

In this bio-pic, George Jung is a guy who starts out by selling pot in the California area. After a while though, he progresses to selling cocaine in the late 70's and early 80's with the infamous Pablo Ecobar, and becomes a multi-millionaire (Jung, played by Jonny Depp very well, explains that if you bought cocaine in that time period in America, there would be a 85 percent chance it was from him). But then we see how things change with time, especially with Jung, which makes this movie even more fascinating and excellent.

While Blow is stylish, smart and hard edged with good stuff, the film also has compassion and feeling, in-particular in the third act which gives this movie a clever turn. Also with brilliant acting from the cast (the ensemble includes Depp, Paul Ruebens, Penelope Cruz and in a twist of a role from GoodFellas, Ray Liotta as Jung's dad) and a well told story, this is one of the best bio-pics and drug movies of the 00's.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":250534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2001-04-06","keywords":"drug abuse,nosebleed,police officer,drug cartel,united states","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blow","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3504603417","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUyMmUwMWQtYWFkZC00YTAxLWJiNjUtMTA0NzY0OTZlMGFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUyMmUwMWQtYWFkZC00YTAxLWJiNjUtMTA0NzY0OTZlMGFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000136/","name":"Johnny Depp","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004851/","name":"Penélope Cruz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004376/","name":"Franka Potente"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001130/","name":"Ted Demme"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072799/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028247/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0692051/","name":"Bruce Porter","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0571346/","name":"David McKenna","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001024/","name":"Nick Cassavetes"],"duration":"PT2H4M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Running Scared
Panično bekstvo
programme.desc:
Running Scared: Directed by Wayne Kramer. With Paul Walker, Cameron Bright, Vera Farmiga, Chazz Palminteri. A low-ranking thug is entrusted by his crime boss to dispose of a gun that killed corrupt cops, but things get out of control when the gun ends up in wrong hands." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0404390/","name":"Running Scared","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTIwOTAzMDc4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjY5MzIzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A low-ranking thug is entrusted by his crime boss to dispose of a gun that killed corrupt cops, but things get out of control when the gun ends up in wrong hands.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0404390/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"xenazues"},"dateCreated":"2016-11-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Forget Fast and the Furious just watch this!!!","reviewBody":"So I reading some reviews and seriously speaking a 7.4 overall is just too low. Now I understand that is pretty high on here. Cause some reason everybody wants to compare every movie to the godfather and gone with the wind. And i love the godfther but lets be real. This was made in 2006 and I'm not sure if you can find another action movie that kept you on the edge of your seat 10 years after it.

I can't think of any. And if I could the acting wouldn't be the same. One thing a lot of people forgot to mention in these reviews. You can watch this movie over and over. Heck I even forgot about the ending. And I've seen this like 5 times already. And where a lot of action movies lack is they drift off and its either not too much action or they play out for the audience at the time. This movie brought it. Notice the female character fits no such stereotypes. Thats a win right there. Her character alone was part of the movie and added so much to it. 

You can just in this movie and wonder what is going to happen. Who is going to get shot, if anybody will get busted. I was once again so impressed with the acting that even the kid who is the main character as well is great at acting. Seems like a natural. Even the ending was great. 

I must say I hear a lot of talk about fast and the furious. And Paul walker was great in those movies (may he rest in peace). But this movie never gets mentioned and I don't know why. The car as well was an attraction."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":99200,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2006-02-24","keywords":"white panties,panties,kissing while having sex,adult child friendship,fistfight","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Running Scared","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2642411801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzhkNjdkNjktM2JlZS00MTI1LWFiZmUtOTFlZTVkNGZiOTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzhkNjdkNjktM2JlZS00MTI1LWFiZmUtOTFlZTVkNGZiOTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from New Line Cinema"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0908094/","name":"Paul Walker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1080974/","name":"Cameron Bright"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001590/","name":"Chazz Palminteri"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0469694/","name":"Wayne Kramer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051264/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0122499/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0469694/","name":"Wayne Kramer"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Official Secrets
Vladine tajne
programme.desc:
Official Secrets: Directed by Gavin Hood. With Keira Knightley, Matt Smith, Matthew Goode, Rhys Ifans. The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5431890/","name":"Official Secrets","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjY1NWYwZmEtNGE3Ny00YTZhLThmZTMtNGI2MDY0MGU5YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5431890/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"agmoldham"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really Enjoyable","reviewBody":"Official Secrets studies the events that are happening in intelligence during the run up to the second gulf war. Having lived through the times myself was aware of the background to the movie, but unaware of the specific story that it explores.

Keira Knightly plays Katharine Gun who works at GCHQ collecting intelligence for the UK. She is concerned about the accuracy of the intelligence that is being used to prove the case for war. The British and American government need a resolution passing at the United Nations to legitimize the war. A memo is distributed to collect intelligence on the United Nations members that can be used to coax them into voting for the resolution. She is shocked by this and wants to stop the war.

In the same way that Brexit dominates British news at the moment WMD's dominated the next back then. The movie is good and shows the pressure that everybody is under. You get the chance to wonder whether you would make the same decisions as Katharine and whether she was right to do it.

I've never been a big fan of Knightly, but she does a fine job in Official Secrets. Well worth a watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":43655,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-08-30","keywords":"whistleblower,courtroom,cafe,british politics,spy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4129995801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWE3Njg0NjctOTk0ZC00YjNjLWI5OGEtMWMyYmI4YTFhZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWE3Njg0NjctOTk0ZC00YjNjLWI5OGEtMWMyYmI4YTFhZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Katharine Gun (Keira Knightley), a British intelligence specialist whose job involves routine handling of classified information. One day in 2003, in the lead up to the Iraq War, Gun receives a memo from the NSA with a shocking directive: the United States is enlisting Britain's help in collecting compromising information on United Nations Security Council members in order to blackmail them into voting in favor of an invasion of Iraq. Unable to stand by and watch the world be rushed into an illegal war, Gun makes the decision to defy her government and leak the memo to the press. So begins an explosive chain of events that will ignite an international firestorm, expose a vast political conspiracy, and put Gun and her family directly in harm's way."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461136/","name":"Keira Knightley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1741002/","name":"Matt Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0328828/","name":"Matthew Goode"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004303/","name":"Gavin Hood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0760923/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0681278/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077135/","name":"Sara Bernstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077052/","name":"Gregory Bernstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004303/","name":"Gavin Hood"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Savages

Planned to detail, it seems like a perfect murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120787/","name":"A Perfect Murder","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwODQxNTEyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTE3NzI3._V1_.jpg","description":"A wealthy Wall Street speculator discovers that his wife has a lover. Creative, artsy, and many cliffhangers","reviewBody":"Micheal Douglas (Steven) and Gwenyth Paltrow (Emily) are a married couple. Emily falls in love and has an affair with a young painter, David Shaw (Mortensen). Hiding the affair and making a tense move, Emily is put in the position to tell Steven or not. One way or another Steven has a plan, a plan to murder his own wife....with a little help from the someone else.\n\nI really love this movie. I try to watch it as much as possible. In this movie it is set to the level of Micheal Douglas's creepy and insanity side of his acting. He scared me so much that I didn't feel comfortable about seeing this for the first time. Gwenyth Paltrow on the other hand, plays a very innocent and lovely role. She really doesn't have a clue what Steven and David are up to in this twisting thriller. Viggo is absolutely excellent in this movie. He gave an outstanding role and put another character on my favorite list. This is a very good movie and I recommend this movie to Alfred Hitchcock and mystery/murder fans. I would rate this 10/10"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83316,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1998-06-05","keywords":"woman in jeopardy,urban setting,cell phone,murder,woman murders attacker","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Perfect Murder","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2813591833","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjE1YmE1MTEtOTU5MC00NmMxLWJlMTUtMTdkZTgxYTcyOTNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjE1YmE1MTEtOTU5MC00NmMxLWJlMTUtMTdkZTgxYTcyOTNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000140/","name":"Michael Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000569/","name":"Gwyneth Paltrow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001557/","name":"Viggo Mortensen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001112/","name":"Andrew Davis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044240/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461425/","name":"Frederick Knott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0446761/","name":"Patrick Smith Kelly"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

Jackal is an unknown man and he's solely known by a convict terrorist from IRA named Declan(Richard Gere).He's given a bargain by an experienced FBI official(Sidney Poitier)and his group(Diane Venora,J.K.Simmons) and the chase,the manhunt, is on to find the vicious killer escaped with ominous purports.They team up to catch the biggest world hired murderer.Declan contacts with an ex-ETA terrorist(Mathilda May)who had a deep relationship with Jackal.Meanwhile the unemotional murderer is preparing the hired assassination and buys technological weapon to an arms-crafter(Jack Black)what are experimented in alive(in similar scenes from the first version with Cryl Cusak).\n\nThe picture contains lots of action,suspenseful,past paced thriller,intrigue,tension but at times it seems too similar to another action films.Agreeable chemistry between Richard Gere and Sidney Poitier along with excellent action sequences like as the breathtaking final game in the subway are someone of the worthwhile items in this rehash from the classical Day of Jackal.Willis,Gere and Poitier,the trio protagonist, make a solid portrayal of their characters backed by a splendid secondary casting. The film is based in Frederick Forsyth's best selling novel of political intrigue previously adapted successful by Fred Zinnemann with Edward Fox.However here is quite different,but the target is political ,the general Charles de Gaulle by the OAS(terrorist organization anti-independence Algeria),while in this film is apparently the FBI's director. Planned to detail, it seems like a perfect murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120787/","name":"A Perfect Murder","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwODQxNTEyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTE3NzI3._V1_.jpg","description":"A wealthy Wall Street speculator discovers that his wife has a lover. Planned to detail, it seems like a perfect murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120787/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"VigtoriousPainter"},"dateCreated":"2004-06-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"I love this movie! Creative, artsy, and many cliffhangers","reviewBody":"Micheal Douglas (Steven) and Gwenyth Paltrow (Emily) are a married couple. Emily falls in love and has an affair with a young painter, David Shaw (Mortensen). Hiding the affair and making a tense move, Emily is put in the position to tell Steven or not. One way or another Steven has a plan, a plan to murder his own wife....with a little help from the someone else.\n\nI really love this movie. I try to watch it as much as possible. In this movie it is set to the level of Micheal Douglas's creepy and insanity side of his acting. He scared me so much that I didn't feel comfortable about seeing this for the first time. Gwenyth Paltrow on the other hand, plays a very innocent and lovely role. She really doesn't have a clue what Steven and David are up to in this twisting thriller. Viggo is absolutely excellent in this movie. He gave an outstanding role and put another character on my favorite list. This is a very good movie and I recommend this movie to Alfred Hitchcock and mystery/murder fans. I would rate this 10/10"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83316,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1998-06-05","keywords":"woman in jeopardy,urban setting,cell phone,murder,woman murders attacker","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Perfect Murder","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2813591833","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjE1YmE1MTEtOTU5MC00NmMxLWJlMTUtMTdkZTgxYTcyOTNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjE1YmE1MTEtOTU5MC00NmMxLWJlMTUtMTdkZTgxYTcyOTNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000140/","name":"Michael Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000569/","name":"Gwyneth Paltrow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001557/","name":"Viggo Mortensen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001112/","name":"Andrew Davis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044240/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461425/","name":"Frederick Knott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0446761/","name":"Patrick Smith Kelly"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Šakal
programme.desc: Ruski mafijaš traži osvetu zbog ubistva njegovog brata u jednom moskovskom klubu. On unajmljuje Šakala, surovog ubicu koga niko nikada nije video, da ubije šefa FBI-ja. Neuhvatljivi plaćeni ubica Šakal dobio je od ruske mafije nalog za ubistvo visoko pozicionirane osobe u američkoj tajnoj službi. Nemajući drugog izbora, zamenik direktora FBI-a i hrabra Valentina Koslova, angažuju jedinu osobu koja je ikada videla Šakala - osuđenog snajperistu.

programme.title: Official Secrets
Vladine tajne
programme.desc:
Official Secrets: Directed by Gavin Hood. With Keira Knightley, Matt Smith, Matthew Goode, Rhys Ifans. The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5431890/","name":"Official Secrets","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjY1NWYwZmEtNGE3Ny00YTZhLThmZTMtNGI2MDY0MGU5YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5431890/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"agmoldham"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really Enjoyable","reviewBody":"Official Secrets studies the events that are happening in intelligence during the run up to the second gulf war. Having lived through the times myself was aware of the background to the movie, but unaware of the specific story that it explores.

Keira Knightly plays Katharine Gun who works at GCHQ collecting intelligence for the UK. She is concerned about the accuracy of the intelligence that is being used to prove the case for war. The British and American government need a resolution passing at the United Nations to legitimize the war. A memo is distributed to collect intelligence on the United Nations members that can be used to coax them into voting for the resolution. She is shocked by this and wants to stop the war.

In the same way that Brexit dominates British news at the moment WMD's dominated the next back then. The movie is good and shows the pressure that everybody is under. You get the chance to wonder whether you would make the same decisions as Katharine and whether she was right to do it.

I've never been a big fan of Knightly, but she does a fine job in Official Secrets. Well worth a watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":43655,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-08-30","keywords":"whistleblower,courtroom,cafe,british politics,spy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4129995801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWE3Njg0NjctOTk0ZC00YjNjLWI5OGEtMWMyYmI4YTFhZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWE3Njg0NjctOTk0ZC00YjNjLWI5OGEtMWMyYmI4YTFhZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Katharine Gun (Keira Knightley), a British intelligence specialist whose job involves routine handling of classified information. One day in 2003, in the lead up to the Iraq War, Gun receives a memo from the NSA with a shocking directive: the United States is enlisting Britain's help in collecting compromising information on United Nations Security Council members in order to blackmail them into voting in favor of an invasion of Iraq. Unable to stand by and watch the world be rushed into an illegal war, Gun makes the decision to defy her government and leak the memo to the press. So begins an explosive chain of events that will ignite an international firestorm, expose a vast political conspiracy, and put Gun and her family directly in harm's way."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461136/","name":"Keira Knightley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1741002/","name":"Matt Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0328828/","name":"Matthew Goode"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004303/","name":"Gavin Hood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0760923/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0681278/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077135/","name":"Sara Bernstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077052/","name":"Gregory Bernstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004303/","name":"Gavin Hood"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Most Violent Year
Zemlja nasilja
programme.desc:
A Most Violent Year: Directed by J.C. Chandor. With Oscar Isaac, Elyes Gabel, Jessica Chastain, Lorna Pruce. In New York City 1981, an ambitious immigrant fights to protect his business and family during the most dangerous year in the city's history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2937898/","name":"A Most Violent Year","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE4OTY4ODg3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTI1MTg1MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In New York City 1981, an ambitious immigrant fights to protect his business and family during the most dangerous year in the city's history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2937898/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dfranzen70"},"dateCreated":"2015-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"When I was 11, it was a very violent year...","reviewBody":"In 1981, an immigrant oilman struggles to improve his fortune and protect his family during the most dangerous year in New York City's history. A Most Violent Year is a strong, character-driven drama that's lifted infinitely by terrific lead performances by Oscar Isaacs and Jessica Chastain, inflating what could have been a tiresome, trite look at one man versus the world in an unkind city.

Abel Morales (Isaac) runs Standard Oil, and he has his eyes on some prime waterfront real estate. With this land, he'll be able to fill his trucks from directly from the oil barges on the river, rather than have the oil transported from boat to someone else's trucks and then to his warehouses. And by saving money there, he'll be able to buy a little more oil than he normally would, keep it on the premises, and then sell it to customers or competitors when demand rises. He makes a deal for the land with a sizable down payment and the stipulation that the balance be tendered within 30 days - no extensions allowed. This, of course, is before Abel's company comes under investigation by an intrepid detective (David Oyelowo), his trucks get highjacked and the oil stolen, and his backers start to, well, back away.

But Abel is no wilting flower, whether he's dealing with the fuzz or the other oilmen in the city. He has his convictions, and damned if he's going to give them up to appease anyone. Which, as you might suspect, makes things a little more difficult. His wife Anna (Chastain), who can match Abel in sheer willpower, is also fiercely protective of her husband, her business (she's the bookkeeper), and her family. Sort of a two-pronged attack. Abel's charm and style nets him both friends and enemies, but this isn't yet another mobster movie by any means. In fact, the only direct evidence of organized crime in the movie centers around Abel's competition - men who would do anything to maintain and/or increase their share of the lucrative oil business in the city.

Both Isaacs (Inside Llewyn Davis) and Chastain (Interstellar) deliver powerful performances that manage to be both relatable and fascinating. Theirs is not a one-sided relationship. Abel is not some power-mad, bombastic husband who treats the wife and kids as either baggage or items to be used for fun and profit. Anna is not some melodramatic, over-spirited harpy who resents her husband's work obsession. They work together even when they disagree. And I would be remiss if I didn't mention an almost unrecognizable Albert Brooks, the company's astute and slightly amoral lawyer. Brooks, in what appears to be a Karl Malden wig, is a real treat.

A Most Violent Year carries a strong message, and that message is this: don't count the little guy out, particularly when he (and his spouse) is whip-smart, unafraid to take chances, and endlessly resourceful. High praise indeed for director J.C. Chandor (All Is Lost) and his talented cast.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70174,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-01-30","keywords":"new york city,american dream,oil,year 1981,immigrant","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi891727641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxOTMxNTg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDY4NTMzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxOTMxNTg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDY4NTMzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In New York City 1981, an ambitious immigrant fights to protect his business and family during the most dangerous year in the city's history.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1209966/","name":"Oscar Isaac"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1567113/","name":"Jessica Chastain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654648/","name":"David Oyelowo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1170855/","name":"J.C. Chandor"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0271126/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0092503/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1170855/","name":"J.C. Chandor"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Adijan Monk je brilijantni privatni detektiv, koji je nakon nervnog sloma posle smrti voljene supruge, otpušten iz policije. Kriminalistička, dramska serija prati slučajeve simpatičnog i sasvim neobičnog detektiva, Adrijana Monka. Monk pati od opsesivno-kompulsivnog poremećaja, od kad je doživeo stres posle smrti supruge. Iako je nakon nervnog sloma otpušten iz policije, njegovo fotografsko pamćenje i fantastična moć opažanja, omogućuju mu da reši slučajeve u kojima je policija nemoćna.

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Britanska, istorijska, dramska serija donosi priču o Rosu Poldarku, koji se posle tri godine provedene u ratu vraća kući, gde više ništa nije kao što je bilo. Britanska, istorijska, dramska serija donosi priču o Rosu Poldarku, koji se posle tri godine provedene u ratu vraća kući, gde više ništa nije kao što je bilo.

programme.title: Mad Men
Momci s Madisona
programme.desc: Mad Men: Created by Matthew Weiner. With Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser, January Jones. A drama about one of New York's most prestigious ad agencies at the beginning of the 1960s, focusing on one of the firm's most mysterious but extremely talented ad executives, Donald Draper." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0804503/","name":"Mad Men","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTgxNDZlODQtNDcwOC00NWQ5LTljNWMtMDhjY2U5YTUzMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drama about one of New York's most prestigious ad agencies at the beginning of the 1960s, focusing on one of the firm's most mysterious but extremely talented ad executives, Donald Draper.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0804503/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"John_Truby"},"dateCreated":"2010-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ambitious with good cause","reviewBody":"Mad Men is one of the best-written and most ambitious TV shows in some time. It is worth close study, not just for learning how to create a well-structured show but also how to write one that is truly original and potentially groundbreaking. Story world, or arena, is one of the key structural elements in any TV drama (see the TV Drama Class for how to create this element, as well as the other essential structural elements of a successful show). It is where the story takes place and it usually exists within some specific arena that not only delineates a recognizable unit but also has a set of rules, activities and values that defines the characters. One of the strengths of Mad Men is its story world. Instead of the usual arena of cops, lawyers, or doctors, Mad Men takes us into a Manhattan advertising agency in 1960. Besides being totally unique in TV, this story world is extremely detailed. And the detailing isn't simply a matter of the set design, which is fabulous. It is written into every episode. The writers weave all manner of cultural icons of the late 50s-early 60s, including TV shows, ads, and fashion. This has two great advantages. One is the pleasure of recognition. If you were a kid at that time, as I was, the show is a virtual time machine. And even if you weren't, the authenticity and texture immerse you in the world and make you feel that "You are there!" The other great advantage is that this past world tricks the audience into believing that this is how it really was back then. The first thing we notice when we see all of these details is how much the world has changed. Everybody smoked back then. The men were in charge and the women were all secretaries and housewives. That sets up the kicker. By first thinking how much we've changed, we then realize, with even more impact, all the ways we haven't. This story, set in 1960, is really about today, or more exactly, the ways that human nature only puts on a new skin and the same fundamental challenges of creating a meaningful life must be faced by each of us, every moment of every day. Another structural element that immediately jumps out at you if you want to create a TV show or write for one is the desire line. In Mad Men the desire that structures each episode is fairly nebulous, and that's probably going to cut into the show's popularity (I hope I'm wrong on this one). Desire is the main reason almost all TV shows are set in the cop, lawyer, and doctor arenas. These jobs give their shows a simple and repeatable desire line that tracks the episode every week. Catch the criminal. Win the case. Save the life. But of course this is extremely limiting. Most people don't spend their daily lives solving crimes, prosecuting bad guys, and saving lives. So while the desire line on this show may be more nebulous, it is far closer to what most Americans do in their daily lives. These Mad Men are in the business of selling, which, as Arthur Miller pointed out long ago, is the archetypal American action. But they aren't selling a particular product. They're selling desire, some image of the good life that, because it is a fabricated ideal, is always just out of reach. Writer Matthew Weiner's brilliant conception for this show is to connect the selling of desire to America to the personal and work lives of the ad men themselves. The ad men want the image of the good life in America that they are selling to be true, even if they intellectually make fun of the poor suckers out there who buy it. Main character Don Draper is handsome and talented, with a beautiful wife and two cute little kids. But he has some secrets he's keeping  like a mistress in the city  and he feels a terrible void he has no idea how to shake. Draper is a master at manipulating desire and creating facades, so when he tries to live the promise for real, the "good life" falls apart in his hands. We are in Far from Heaven and American Beauty territory here. And the second episode even had Draper give his own version of the Existentialist credo of Sartre and Camus that was seeping into pop culture during the late 50s (how's that for a sweet detail on a TV show?). We'll have to see whether Mad Men can extend beyond a few episodes without imploding. Besides the lack of a clean desire line, the subject of hollow suburban existence will make it extremely difficult for the writers to develop the show over the long term without beating a spiritually dead horse. In the meantime, I'm going to sit back and enjoy some great dramatic writing, and nowadays TV is the only place you'll find it."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":224397,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-07-19","keywords":"advertising,chain smoking,1960s,new york,drinking","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0358316/","name":"Jon Hamm"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005253/","name":"Elisabeth Moss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440229/","name":"Vincent Kartheiser"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026995/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0247554/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019701/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1980806/","name":"Matthew Weiner"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi69710105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEzNTI3ODk0NjZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQyOTg5MDUx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEzNTI3ODk0NjZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQyOTg5MDUx._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch a trailer for AMC's "Mad Men.""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bruklin 9-9
programme.desc: Džejk Peralt, nezreli, ali talentovani detektiv iz Bruklina, dolazi u neposredni sukob sa svojim novim zapovednikom, ozbiljnim i strogim kapetanom Rejom Holtom. Tim detektiva iz 99. stanice u Bruklinu dobija novog kapetana Rejmonda Holta, veoma ozbiljnog i strogog komandantnog oficira, za razliku od ranijeg kapetana na koga su se svi u ovoj stanici navikli, i zato nastaje sukob detektiva Paralte i Rejmonda. Ejmi Santijago, vredna detektivka koja se uvek drži knjige, u početku ima kompetativni odnos sa Džejkom zbog brojnih uspeha sa obe strane, a kasnije njihova netrpljivost prerasta u romantičnu vezu. Takođe u ovoj stanici se nalaze detektiv Čarls Bojl, Džejkov najbolji drug, narednik Teri Džefords, veoma snažan i krupan ali osetljiv i porodičan čovek, Roza Dijaz, veoma agresivna i sposobna detektivka, asistentkinja Đina Lineti, veoma duhovit lik u seriji, i dva već starija detektiva koji su sada zaduženi za kancelarijski deo policijskog posla, Hičkok i Skali.

programme.title: Dobri doktor
programme.desc: Američka, medicinska drama u kojoj je glavni lik mladi hirurg Šon Marfi, autistični genije koji na stvari gleda drugačije od ostalih. "The Good Doctor" je američka, medicinska, dramska serija u kojoj je glavni lik neobični, mladi hirurg Šon Marfi, autistični genije koji sve posmatra drugačije od ostalih i koji se iz rodnog Vajominga seli u San Hoze kako bi se zaposlio u prestižnoj bolnici Svetog Bonaventure. Uprkos tome što nema socijalne veštine i ne snalazi se u međuljudskim odnosima i nepoznati su mu pojmovi poput sreće i ljubavi, on je neverovatan stručnjak. Doktor Šon je izuzetno drag i inteligentan, ali ga šef ipak uzima na zub, zbog njegovog direktnosti i nespretnog ponašanja prema pacijentima, međutim, njegova genijlanost je neosporna.

programme.title: Mr. Mercedes
programme.desc: Priča o ubici koji vozi ukraden Mercedes sa kojim je uleteo u grupu ljudi i detektivu koji pokušava da ga uhvati. Priča o ubici koji vozi ukraden Mercedes sa kojim je uleteo u grupu ljudi i detektivu koji pokušava da ga uhvati.

programme.title: Mladi Drakula
programme.desc: Samohrani otac grof Drakula iz Transilvanije se seli u Britaniju sa svoje dvoje dece, Vladom i Ingrid. Samohrani otac, grof Drakula se seli iz Transilvanije u modernu Britaniju sa svoje dvoje dece, Vladom i Ingrid. Na užas svog oca, Vlad junak serije, ne želi da ujeda, već nastoji da se uklopi sa svojim novopronađenim britanskim prijateljima.

credits.actor: Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay, Richard Belzer, Diane Neal, Dean Winters, Michelle Hurd, Stephanie March, Ice-T

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Adijan Monk je brilijantni privatni detektiv, koji je nakon nervnog sloma posle smrti voljene supruge, otpušten iz policije. Kriminalistička, dramska serija prati slučajeve simpatičnog i sasvim neobičnog detektiva, Adrijana Monka. Monk pati od opsesivno-kompulsivnog poremećaja, od kad je doživeo stres posle smrti supruge. Iako je nakon nervnog sloma otpušten iz policije, njegovo fotografsko pamćenje i fantastična moć opažanja, omogućuju mu da reši slučajeve u kojima je policija nemoćna.

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Britanska, istorijska, dramska serija donosi priču o Rosu Poldarku, koji se posle tri godine provedene u ratu vraća kući, gde više ništa nije kao što je bilo. Britanska, istorijska, dramska serija donosi priču o Rosu Poldarku, koji se posle tri godine provedene u ratu vraća kući, gde više ništa nije kao što je bilo.

credits.actor: Bob Odenkirk, Rhea Seehorn, Jonathan Banks, Michael McKean, Patrick Fabian, Michael Mando, Julie Ann Emery, Jeremy Shamos

programme.title: Mad Men
Momci s Madisona
programme.desc: Mad Men: Created by Matthew Weiner. With Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser, January Jones. A drama about one of New York's most prestigious ad agencies at the beginning of the 1960s, focusing on one of the firm's most mysterious but extremely talented ad executives, Donald Draper." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0804503/","name":"Mad Men","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTgxNDZlODQtNDcwOC00NWQ5LTljNWMtMDhjY2U5YTUzMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drama about one of New York's most prestigious ad agencies at the beginning of the 1960s, focusing on one of the firm's most mysterious but extremely talented ad executives, Donald Draper.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0804503/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"John_Truby"},"dateCreated":"2010-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ambitious with good cause","reviewBody":"Mad Men is one of the best-written and most ambitious TV shows in some time. It is worth close study, not just for learning how to create a well-structured show but also how to write one that is truly original and potentially groundbreaking. Story world, or arena, is one of the key structural elements in any TV drama (see the TV Drama Class for how to create this element, as well as the other essential structural elements of a successful show). It is where the story takes place and it usually exists within some specific arena that not only delineates a recognizable unit but also has a set of rules, activities and values that defines the characters. One of the strengths of Mad Men is its story world. Instead of the usual arena of cops, lawyers, or doctors, Mad Men takes us into a Manhattan advertising agency in 1960. Besides being totally unique in TV, this story world is extremely detailed. And the detailing isn't simply a matter of the set design, which is fabulous. It is written into every episode. The writers weave all manner of cultural icons of the late 50s-early 60s, including TV shows, ads, and fashion. This has two great advantages. One is the pleasure of recognition. If you were a kid at that time, as I was, the show is a virtual time machine. And even if you weren't, the authenticity and texture immerse you in the world and make you feel that "You are there!" The other great advantage is that this past world tricks the audience into believing that this is how it really was back then. The first thing we notice when we see all of these details is how much the world has changed. Everybody smoked back then. The men were in charge and the women were all secretaries and housewives. That sets up the kicker. By first thinking how much we've changed, we then realize, with even more impact, all the ways we haven't. This story, set in 1960, is really about today, or more exactly, the ways that human nature only puts on a new skin and the same fundamental challenges of creating a meaningful life must be faced by each of us, every moment of every day. Another structural element that immediately jumps out at you if you want to create a TV show or write for one is the desire line. In Mad Men the desire that structures each episode is fairly nebulous, and that's probably going to cut into the show's popularity (I hope I'm wrong on this one). Desire is the main reason almost all TV shows are set in the cop, lawyer, and doctor arenas. These jobs give their shows a simple and repeatable desire line that tracks the episode every week. Catch the criminal. Win the case. Save the life. But of course this is extremely limiting. Most people don't spend their daily lives solving crimes, prosecuting bad guys, and saving lives. So while the desire line on this show may be more nebulous, it is far closer to what most Americans do in their daily lives. These Mad Men are in the business of selling, which, as Arthur Miller pointed out long ago, is the archetypal American action. But they aren't selling a particular product. They're selling desire, some image of the good life that, because it is a fabricated ideal, is always just out of reach. Writer Matthew Weiner's brilliant conception for this show is to connect the selling of desire to America to the personal and work lives of the ad men themselves. The ad men want the image of the good life in America that they are selling to be true, even if they intellectually make fun of the poor suckers out there who buy it. Main character Don Draper is handsome and talented, with a beautiful wife and two cute little kids. But he has some secrets he's keeping  like a mistress in the city  and he feels a terrible void he has no idea how to shake. Draper is a master at manipulating desire and creating facades, so when he tries to live the promise for real, the "good life" falls apart in his hands. We are in Far from Heaven and American Beauty territory here. And the second episode even had Draper give his own version of the Existentialist credo of Sartre and Camus that was seeping into pop culture during the late 50s (how's that for a sweet detail on a TV show?). We'll have to see whether Mad Men can extend beyond a few episodes without imploding. Besides the lack of a clean desire line, the subject of hollow suburban existence will make it extremely difficult for the writers to develop the show over the long term without beating a spiritually dead horse. In the meantime, I'm going to sit back and enjoy some great dramatic writing, and nowadays TV is the only place you'll find it."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":224397,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-07-19","keywords":"advertising,chain smoking,1960s,new york,drinking","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0358316/","name":"Jon Hamm"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005253/","name":"Elisabeth Moss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440229/","name":"Vincent Kartheiser"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026995/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0247554/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019701/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1980806/","name":"Matthew Weiner"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi69710105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEzNTI3ODk0NjZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQyOTg5MDUx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEzNTI3ODk0NjZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQyOTg5MDUx._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch a trailer for AMC's "Mad Men.""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bruklin 9-9
programme.desc: Džejk Peralt, nezreli, ali talentovani detektiv iz Bruklina, dolazi u neposredni sukob sa svojim novim zapovednikom, ozbiljnim i strogim kapetanom Rejom Holtom. Tim detektiva iz 99. stanice u Bruklinu dobija novog kapetana Rejmonda Holta, veoma ozbiljnog i strogog komandantnog oficira, za razliku od ranijeg kapetana na koga su se svi u ovoj stanici navikli, i zato nastaje sukob detektiva Paralte i Rejmonda. Ejmi Santijago, vredna detektivka koja se uvek drži knjige, u početku ima kompetativni odnos sa Džejkom zbog brojnih uspeha sa obe strane, a kasnije njihova netrpljivost prerasta u romantičnu vezu. Takođe u ovoj stanici se nalaze detektiv Čarls Bojl, Džejkov najbolji drug, narednik Teri Džefords, veoma snažan i krupan ali osetljiv i porodičan čovek, Roza Dijaz, veoma agresivna i sposobna detektivka, asistentkinja Đina Lineti, veoma duhovit lik u seriji, i dva već starija detektiva koji su sada zaduženi za kancelarijski deo policijskog posla, Hičkok i Skali.

programme.title: Dobri doktor
programme.desc: Američka, medicinska drama u kojoj je glavni lik mladi hirurg Šon Marfi, autistični genije koji na stvari gleda drugačije od ostalih. "The Good Doctor" je američka, medicinska, dramska serija u kojoj je glavni lik neobični, mladi hirurg Šon Marfi, autistični genije koji sve posmatra drugačije od ostalih i koji se iz rodnog Vajominga seli u San Hoze kako bi se zaposlio u prestižnoj bolnici Svetog Bonaventure. Uprkos tome što nema socijalne veštine i ne snalazi se u međuljudskim odnosima i nepoznati su mu pojmovi poput sreće i ljubavi, on je neverovatan stručnjak. Doktor Šon je izuzetno drag i inteligentan, ali ga šef ipak uzima na zub, zbog njegovog direktnosti i nespretnog ponašanja prema pacijentima, međutim, njegova genijlanost je neosporna.

programme.title: Mr. Mercedes
programme.desc: Priča o ubici koji vozi ukraden Mercedes sa kojim je uleteo u grupu ljudi i detektivu koji pokušava da ga uhvati. Priča o ubici koji vozi ukraden Mercedes sa kojim je uleteo u grupu ljudi i detektivu koji pokušava da ga uhvati.

A drama about one of New York's most prestigious ad agencies at the beginning of the 1960s, focusing on one of the firm's most mysterious but extremely talented ad executives, Donald Draper." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0804503/","name":"Mad Men","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTgxNDZlODQtNDcwOC00NWQ5LTljNWMtMDhjY2U5YTUzMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drama about one of New York's most prestigious ad agencies at the beginning of the 1960s, focusing on one of the firm's most mysterious but extremely talented ad executives, Donald Draper.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0804503/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"John_Truby","dateCreated":"2010-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ambitious with good cause","reviewBody":"Mad Men is one of the best-written and most ambitious TV shows in some time. It is worth close study, not just for learning how to create a well-structured show but also how to write one that is truly original and potentially groundbreaking. Story world, or arena, is one of the key structural elements in any TV drama (see the TV Drama Class for how to create this element, as well as the other essential structural elements of a successful show). It is where the story takes place and it usually exists within some specific arena that not only delineates a recognizable unit but also has a set of rules, activities and values that defines the characters. One of the strengths of Mad Men is its story world. Instead of the usual arena of cops, lawyers, or doctors, Mad Men takes us into a Manhattan advertising agency in 1960. Besides being totally unique in TV, this story world is extremely detailed. And the detailing isn't simply a matter of the set design, which is fabulous. It is written into every episode. The writers weave all manner of cultural icons of the late 50s-early 60s, including TV shows, ads, and fashion. This has two great advantages. One is the pleasure of recognition. If you were a kid at that time, as I was, the show is a virtual time machine. And even if you weren't, the authenticity and texture immerse you in the world and make you feel that "You are there!" The other great advantage is that this past world tricks the audience into believing that this is how it really was back then. The first thing we notice when we see all of these details is how much the world has changed. Everybody smoked back then. The men were in charge and the women were all secretaries and housewives. That sets up the kicker. By first thinking how much we've changed, we then realize, with even more impact, all the ways we haven't. This story, set in 1960, is really about today, or more exactly, the ways that human nature only puts on a new skin and the same fundamental challenges of creating a meaningful life must be faced by each of us, every moment of every day. Another structural element that immediately jumps out at you if you want to create a TV show or write for one is the desire line. In Mad Men the desire that structures each episode is fairly nebulous, and that's probably going to cut into the show's popularity (I hope I'm wrong on this one). Desire is the main reason almost all TV shows are set in the cop, lawyer, and doctor arenas. These jobs give their shows a simple and repeatable desire line that tracks the episode every week. Catch the criminal. Win the case. Save the life. But of course this is extremely limiting. Most people don't spend their daily lives solving crimes, prosecuting bad guys, and saving lives. So while the desire line on this show may be more nebulous, it is far closer to what most Americans do in their daily lives. These Mad Men are in the business of selling, which, as Arthur Miller pointed out long ago, is the archetypal American action. But they aren't selling a particular product. They're selling desire, some image of the good life that, because it is a fabricated ideal, is always just out of reach. Writer Matthew Weiner's brilliant conception for this show is to connect the selling of desire to America to the personal and work lives of the ad men themselves. The ad men want the image of the good life in America that they are selling to be true, even if they intellectually make fun of the poor suckers out there who buy it. Main character Don Draper is handsome and talented, with a beautiful wife and two cute little kids. But he has some secrets he's keeping  like a mistress in the city  and he feels a terrible void he has no idea how to shake. Draper is a master at manipulating desire and creating facades, so when he tries to live the promise for real, the "good life" falls apart in his hands. We are in Far from Heaven and American Beauty territory here. And the second episode even had Draper give his own version of the Existentialist credo of Sartre and Camus that was seeping into pop culture during the late 50s (how's that for a sweet detail on a TV show?). We'll have to see whether Mad Men can extend beyond a few episodes without imploding. Besides the lack of a clean desire line, the subject of hollow suburban existence will make it extremely difficult for the writers to develop the show over the long term without beating a spiritually dead horse. In the meantime, I'm going to sit back and enjoy some great dramatic writing, and nowadays TV is the only place you'll find it.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":224397,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-07-19","keywords":"advertising,chain smoking,1960s,new york,drinking","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0358316/","name":"Jon Hamm","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005253/","name":"Elisabeth Moss","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440229/","name":"Vincent Kartheiser"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026995/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0247554/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019701/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1980806/","name":"Matthew Weiner"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi69710105","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEzNTI3ODk0NjZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQyOTg5MDUx._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEzNTI3ODk0NjZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDQyOTg5MDUx._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch a trailer for AMC's "Mad Men.""</script><metacontent="
